discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The "Manage User" permission allows users to make organizational changes to user records, including internal users, which goes beyond the desired level of access for a manager responsible for creating and editing only the community users for the Partner Community.

To restrict the manager to only creating and editing community users, you should not assign them the "Manage User" permission. Instead, you should ensure that their permissions are appropriately scoped to manage only community users, typically achieved through custom profiles, permission sets, or sharing settings specific to the Partner Community.

Selected Answer: D
D. CDN can help performance by caching public resources.

CDN services cache static content, such as images, JavaScript files, and CSS files, on servers distributed geographically closer to the end-users. When a user requests content from the site, the CDN serves the cached content from the nearest server, reducing latency and improving load times. This caching mechanism enhances the performance of the site, particularly for static resources that do not frequently change.
